_metadata.description: NegotiationPro rulebook with risk/effectiveness scores, unified conditions and fallback rules.

rules.title: Anchor Framing for Salary Priority
rules.action: Open with market-aligned range, then present a specific anchor with one quantified proof before mentioning perks.
rules.explanation: Anchoring works best early, when counterpart is seeking reference points.

rules.title: Title-as-Value Trade
rules.action: If base salary stalls, propose upgraded title or scope expansion in return for mid-range compensation.
rules.explanation: Helps counterparts save money while granting you symbolic value.

rules.title: Decision Window Ask
rules.action: Request a realistic decision window and schedule a follow-up date to reduce open loops.
rules.explanation: Sets boundaries and prevents endless delays.

rules.title: Limited-Time Concession
rules.action: Offer a small, reversible concession that expires by your stated deadline to focus momentum.

rules.title: High-Power Counterpart
rules.action: Lead with objective criteria and third-party data. Keep asks crisp and timeboxed to avoid endless evaluation.
rules.explanation: Objective anchors protect against overpowering negotiation tactics.

rules.title: Peer-Power Reciprocity
rules.action: Use reciprocity: trade a low-cost give for a high-value get (e.g., flexible start date â†” clear title).
rules.explanation: Peers respond well to balanced trades.

rules.title: No Match Found
rules.action: Default to empathy: acknowledge the concern, ask one clarifying question, then pivot to priorities.
rules.explanation: Ensures system never leaves the user without guidance.
